page.shortlink: dt ref db Defining User Settings
page.description: Alpha Anywhere stores certain user settings (defined by the View > Settings command) in the system Registry database under the init key (which is relative to the root key.

section.note: Custom color definitions, which are also defined using the View > Settings command are not stored in the REGISTRY. These are stored in the Database library file.Â See A5.LOAD_USER_COLORS() and A5.SAVE_USER_COLORS() for information on using Xbasic to load and save custom colors.

section.description: The following example shows how you can set the Password field on the Email Settings tab of the View Settings dialog:
section.example: 'initialize the UserSettings variable UserSettings.dummy = "" :registry.load_settings("Init", UserSettings) UserSettings.email.client_password = "MyNewPassword" :registry.save_settings("Init", UserSettings)
